div.div: Read the latest frequently asked questions

h2.a: Supt's Letter to Parents on Grades (April 9, 2020)

div.div: Read about grading policies for second semester.​

After much thought, collaboration, and planning – we are officially releasing our grading policies for second semester. We've vetted these policies amongst our Board, district leadership, site leadership and our Fresno Teachers Association to come to what we believe to be the best opportunity for our students.
Here's what parents and students need to know:
- The quarter 3 grade will be a student's final second semester grade unless a student chooses to improve their grade
- Students will be given multiple opportunities to improve their grades between now and end of our traditional grading period—Seniors May 22, all other students June 1
- No future grade will drop below the grade issued for quarter 3 (which ended March 13)

- Teachers will issue letter grades of A, B, C, and F while D grades will be replaced with 'Pass' in the final second semester grade
Have questions, take a few minutes to complete the feedback tool. ​
Read the latest letter to parents from the superintendent.
Read the latest superintendent's letter to parents.
View the latest questions and their answers.​
Find​​ a number of resources regarding the upcoming 2020 Census.

Non-Discrimination Statement: Fresno Unified School District prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, national origin, immigration status, ancestry, age, creed, religion, political affiliation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, mental or physical disability, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parental status, medical information, military veteran status, or association with a person or a group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics or any other basis protected by law or regulation, in its educational program(s) or employment. If you believe you, or your student, have been subjected to discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying you should contact your school site principal and/or the District’s Chief Compliance and Title IX Officer, by phone at 559-457-3730, by email at titleix@fresnounified.org, or in person at 2309 Tulare Street Fresno, CA 93721.
